page.title: 13Acklington Post Office
page.content: The present{Post Office}has been in operation for 6 years. As it is the only Post Office and{Shop}in the village it is very well used. The opening times are 9.30-12.00 a.m. and 1.00-3.30 p.m. and Mrs V.Taylor, the post-mistress, says the busiest days are Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays, when villagers come to collect their pensions and family allowances. The {mail}is collected twice a day, at 10.30 a.m. and 3.20 p.m. Mrs Taylor has sent parcels from Acklington to places as far away as Australia and Canada. Recently she sent a parcel weighing 10 Kg. The Post Office is also of great{social benefit}to the community. Being central, it is a convenient place to meet and chat with others.{Notices}of village events are placed inside the Post Office and also on the village notice board outside.
